title: MD
biography: Raman Gangakhedkar is an Indian public health expert and epidemiologist. He served as Head Scientist of Epidemiology and Communicable Diseases at the Indian Council of Medical Research before retiring on 30 June 2020. He is a recipient of the 2020 Padma Shri award, the fourth highest civilian award in India.
aiSummary: Raman Gangakhedkar is a medicine specialist with an H-index of 34 at National disease advisory (Member). Has been published in JAMA, The Lancet Global Health, The Lancet. Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.
